Synopsis: 
Inspiring true story that tells how, in the chaos of the Cultural Revolution in China, Cunxin had to leave their own, a family of farmers, to embark on an amazing journey ... which ended up moving toward freedom and personal triumph. 

Li's story unfolds in a time when China was emerging from Mao's great vision. It could not be better time for Li Cunxin discovered the West, and for the West's discovery of Li Cunxin. Mao's last dancer Li tells us how to overcome adversity, and how he discovered and explored their natural abilities and talent as a classical dancer. To do this, not only had to deal with their own physical limitations, but also with the punishment imposed by the Chinese government suspicious after his defection to the United States. 

In the U.S., Li found a fascinating new world, albeit with difficulty that he had never imagined. Although it had the support of many friends, she felt isolated, and, despite his growing fame, he could still see their future with uncertainty. 

Production notes: 
Based on the autobiography of Li Cunxin "Mao's Last Dancer."
